docs.text: GHGA-Metadata-Schema schema ¶ The metadata schema for the German Human Genome-Phenome Archive (GHGA). Classes ¶ Attribute - A key/value pair that further characterizes an entity. DataUseCondition - Data Use Condition represents the use conditions associated with a Dataset. A permission field can have one or more terms that collectively defines the data use condition. The modifier determines the interpretation of the use permission(s). NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Agent - An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity. Agents include a Person, Organization, or Software that performs an activity. BiologicalQuality - A biological quality is a quality held by a biological entity. DiseaseOrPhenotypicFeature - Disease or Phenotypic Feature that the entity is associated with. This entity is a union of Disease and Phenotypic Feature and exists to accommodate situations where Disease concepts are used interchangeably with Phenotype concepts or vice-versa. Disease - A disease is a disposition to undergo pathological processes that exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism. PhenotypicFeature - The observable form taken by some character (or group of characters) in an individual or an organism, excluding pathology and disease. The detectable outward manifestations of a specific genotype. Committee - A group of people organized for a specific purpose. DataAccessCommittee - A group of members that are delegated to grant access to one or more datasets after ensuring the minimum criteria for data sharing has been met, and request for data use does not raise ethical and/or legal concerns. InformationContentEntity - A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing. DataAccessPolicy - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. Dataset - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution. AggregateDataset - An Aggregate Dataset is a specialized dataset that is built by combining one or more Datasets together. AnalysisDataset - An Analysis Dataset is a collection of Files generated from one or more Analysis performed on data from one or more Studies. ExperimentDataset - An Experiment Dataset is a collection of Files linked to one or more Experiments from one or more Studies. File Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. LibraryPreparationProtocol - Information about the library preparation of an Experiment. SequencingProtocol - Information about the sequencing of a sample. Publication - The Publication entity represents a publication. While a publication can be any article that is published, the minimum expectation is that the publication has a valid DOI. Technology - A Technology is an abstraction that represents the instrument used for an assay. The Technology entity captures instrument-specific attributes that are relevant for an Experiment entity. The Technology entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular technology. Workflow - A Workflow is an abstraction that represents the workflow used to perform an analysis. The Workflow entity captures workflow-specific attributes that are relevant for an Analysis entity. The Workflow entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular workflow. WorkflowStep - A Workflow Step represents each individual step performed in a Workflow. If the Workflow is a single-step workflow then the Workflow has just one Workflow Step entity. If the Workflow is a multi-step workflow then the Workflow has a Workflow Step entity for each step. All Workflow step specific attributes like parameters, and metadata about execution environment are captured by the Workflow Step entity. MaterialEntity - A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass. AnatomicalEntity - Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species. Biospecimen - A Biospecimen is any natural material taken from a biological entity (usually a human) for testing, diagnostics, treatment, or research purposes. The Biospecimen is linked to the Individual from which the Biospecimen is derived. CellLine - A cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history. Population - A population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area. Cohort - A cohort is a collection of individuals that share a common characteristic/observation and have been grouped together for a research study/investigation. Family - A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption. Sample - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). Person - A member of the species Homo sapiens. Individual - An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. Donor - A Donor is an Individual that participates in a research Study by donating a Biospecimen. The use of the Biospecimen is restricted to the consent provided by the Donor. Member - Member of an Organization or a Committee. User - A user in GHGA. PlannedProcess - A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. AnalysisProcess - An analysis process is a process that describes how one or more Files, from a Study, are transformed to another set of Files via a Workflow. The analysis process also keeps track of the workflow metadata and the Agent that is running the Analysis. DataTransformation - A data transformation technique used to analyze and interpret data to gain a better understanding of it. Analysis - An Analysis is a data transformation that transforms input data to output data. The workflow used to achieve this transformation and the individual steps are also captured. ExperimentProcess - An Experiment Process is a process that describes how a Sample is transformed to a File via an assay. The Experiment Process also keeps track of the Protocol used and the Agent that is running the experiment. Investigation - Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. Experiment - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. Study - Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied. ResearchActivity - A planned process executed in the performance of scientific research wherein systematic investigations are performed to establish facts and reach new conclusions about phenomena in the world. Project - Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. Submission - A grouping entity that represents information about one or more entities. A submission can be considered as a set of inter-related (and inter-connected) entities that represent a data submission to GHGA. WorkflowParameter - A key/value pair that represents a parameter used in a Workflow Step. Mixins ¶ Slots ¶ abstract - The study abstract that describes the goals. Can also hold abstract from a publication related to this study accession - A unique identifier assigned to an entity for the sole purpose of referring to that entity in a global scope. named thing➞accession additional name - Additional name(s). affiliation - Institutions associated with this study. study➞affiliation age - Age of an individual. individual➞age ancestry - A person's descent or lineage, from a person or from a population. biological replicates - Number of independent samples (biological replicates). experiment➞biological replicates - A biological replicate is a replicate role that consists of independent biological replicates made from different individual biosamples. category - The category for this file: Whole Genome Sequencing, Whole Exome Sequencing, etc. cell barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. (Eg. '0'). cell barcode read - The type of read that contains the cell barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). cell barcode size - The size of the cell identifying barcode (E.g. '16'). checksum - A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. creation date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. named thing➞creation date submission➞creation date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the Submission was created. deprecation date - The timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was deprecated. description - Description of an entity. data access policy➞description - A short description for the Data Access Policy. dataset➞description experiment➞description - A detailed description of the Experiment. project➞description - Short textual description of the project (Some information on the protocol, sample used and collected etc) protocol➞description - Detailed description of the Protocol. library preparation protocol➞description - Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). sequencing protocol➞description - Description about the sequencing protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sample➞description - Short textual description of the sample (How the sample was collected, sample source, protocol followed for processing the sample etc). study➞description - A detailed description (abstract) that describes the goals of this Study. email - Email of a person. member➞email - The email of the Member. end bias - The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. ethnicity - A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. experimental replicates - Number of experiment replications. experiment➞experimental replicates - The replicate number of the assay, i.e. the numeric iteration for the assay that was repeated. family name - Last name. file index - The index for this file. Commonly for BAM/VCF files. flow cell id - Flow Cell ID (eg: Experiment ID_Cell 1_Lane_1). The barcode assigned to a flow cell used in nucleotide sequencing. flow cell type - Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell. format - The format of the file: BAM, SAM, CRAM, BAI, etc. gender - Identification as male/masculine, female/feminine or something else, and association with a (social) role or set of behavioral and cultural traits. geographical region - The geographical region where the Individual is located. Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries. given name - First name. has agent - A person or an entity that is performing a Planned Process entity. analysis process➞has agent - The Agent - a software, institution, or human - that is executing or responsible for executing the workflow. experiment process➞has agent - The Agent - a software, institution, or human - that is executing or responsible for executing the Experiment Process. has analysis - The analysis associated with an entity. study➞has analysis - One or more Analysis entities associated with this Study. submission➞has analysis - Information about one or more Analysis entities associated with this submission. has analysis process analysis➞has analysis process - One or more Analysis Process entities associated with this Analysis. has anatomical entity - Anatomical site associated with an entity. biospecimen➞has anatomical entity - The Anatomical entity, that represents the site, from which the Biospecimen was retrieved. Typically, a concept from Uber-anatomy Ontology (UBERON). For example, 'UBERON:0008307' indicates that the Biospecimen was extracted from the 'Heart Endothelium' of an Individual. has attribute - Key/value pairs corresponding to an entity. named thing➞has attribute - Holds one or more Attribute entities that further characterizes this entity. project➞has attribute - Custom attributes for the Project (eg: Cancer - Colon cancer, prostrate cancer, blood cancer etc) protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Protocol. library preparation protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. sequencing protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Sequencing Protocol. study➞has attribute - Custom key/value pairs that further characterizes the Study. (e.g.: approaches - single-cell, bulk etc) has biospecimen - The biospecimen associated with an entity. sample➞has biospecimen - The Biospecimen from which this Sample was prepared from. submission➞has biospecimen - Information about one or more Biospecimen entities associated with this submission. has children - The children of an entity. individual➞has children - One or more children for this Individual. has data access committee - Data Access Committee associated with an entity. data access policy➞has data access committee - The Data Access Committee linked to this policy. has data access policy - Data Access Policy associated with an entity. analysis dataset➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to this Dataset. experiment dataset➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to this Dataset. submission➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy entity that applies to the data associated with this submission. has data use condition - Data Use Condition entities that are associated with an entity. data access policy➞has data use condition - Data Use Condition entities that are associated with the Data Access Policy. has dataset - The Dataset associated with an entity. aggregate dataset➞has dataset - One or more Datasets that constitutes this Aggregate Dataset. has disease - Disease concept that the entity is associated with. biospecimen➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0005267' indicates that the Individual suffers from 'Heart Disease'. individual➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. has experiment - The experiment associated with an entity. analysis dataset➞has experiment - One or more Analysis entities that are referenced by this Dataset. experiment dataset➞has experiment - One or more Experiment entities that are referenced by this Dataset. study➞has experiment - One or more Experiment entities associated with this Study. submission➞has experiment - Information about one or more Experiment entities associated with this submission. has experiment process experiment➞has experiment process - One or more Experiment Processes entities associated with this Experiment. has file - The file associated with an entity. dataset➞has file - One or more File entities that collectively are part of this Dataset. experiment➞has file - One or more Files entities that are generated as output of this Experiment. submission➞has file - Information about one or more File entities associated with this submission. has individual - The subject/individual associated with an entity. biospecimen➞has individual - The Individual entity from which this Biospecimen was derived. sample➞has individual - The Individual from which this Sample was derived from. submission➞has individual - Information about one or more Individual entities associated with this submission. has input - The input to a Planned Process. analysis process➞has input - The input data File entities used in the Analysis Process. analysis➞has input - The input data File entities used in the Analysis. experiment process➞has input - The input to the Experiment Process. Usually a Sample entity. has library preparation protocol - The Library Preparation Protocol associated with an entity. has member - The members associated with a committee. cohort➞has member - One or more Individuals that collectively define this Cohort. data access committee➞has member - All the members that are part of this Data Access Committee. family➞has member - One or more Individuals that collectively define this Family. has output - The output of a Planned Process entity. analysis process➞has output - The output data File entities generated by the Analysis Process. analysis➞has output - The output data File entities generated by this Analysis. experiment process➞has output - The output of this Experiment Process. Usually a File entity. has parameter - The parameter(s) associated with a Workflow Step entity. workflow step➞has parameter - One or more parameters that are associated with this Workflow Step. has parent - The parent of an entity. individual➞has parent - One or more parent for this Individual. has phenotypic feature - Phenotypic feature concept that the entity is associated with. biospecimen➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. individual➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. has proband - The Individual that is reported to have a disorder in a Family. family➞has proband - The Individual that is reported to have a disorder which results in the Family being brought into a Study. has project - The project associated with an entity. study➞has project - The project associated with this Study. submission➞has project - Information about a Project entity associated with this submission. has protocol - The protocol associated with an entity. experiment process➞has protocol - The Protocol entity used by this Experiment Process. has publication - The Publication associated with an entity. dataset➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Dataset. project➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Project. study➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Study. has sample - The sample associated with an entity. experiment➞has sample - The Sample entity associated with this Experiment. submission➞has sample - Information about one or more Sample entities associated with this submission. has sequencing protocol - The sequencing protocol associated with an entity. has study - The study associated with an entity. analysis dataset➞has study - One or more Study entities that are referenced by this Dataset. analysis➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Analysis. experiment dataset➞has study - One or more Study entities that are referenced by this Dataset. experiment➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Experiment. project➞has study - One or more Study entities associated with this Project. submission➞has study - Information about a Study entities associated with this submission. has technology - The technology associated with an entity. experiment➞has technology - The Technology entity associated with this Experiment. has workflow - The Workflow entity associated wtih a Planned Process entity. analysis➞has workflow - The Workflow entity associated with this Analysis. has workflow step - The individual workflow step that with other workflow step(s) collectively defines a Workflow entity. analysis process➞has workflow step - Workflow Step entity that performs a set of operations on the input data Files to generate a set of output data Files. id - An identifier that uniquely represents an entity. named thing➞id - The internal unique identifier for an entity. publication➞id - A PMID or DOI for the Publication. submission➞id - A internal unique identifier for the Submission. instrument model - The name and model of the technology platform used to perform sequencing. sequencing protocol➞instrument model isolation - Method or device employed for collecting/isolating a sample. key - The key of an attribute. attribute➞key - The key for an attribute. workflow parameter➞key - Key that represents the parameter name. key type - The semantic type for the key of an attribute. attribute➞key type - A semantic type that characterizes the attribute key. Usually this is a term from an ontology. For example, 'MAXO:0000616' indicates that the attribute is a measurement of oxygen saturation in the blood. lane number - he numerical identifier for the lane or machine unit where a sample was located during nucleotide sequencing. library construction - The name of a library construction approach being used. (eg: '10X v2 sequencing' or 'Smart-seq2') library preparation protocol➞library construction library construction kit manufacturer - Manufacturer of library construction kit library preparation protocol➞library construction kit manufacturer library construction kit retail name - A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) library preparation protocol➞library construction kit retail name library layout - Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode library preparation protocol➞library layout library level - Single Cell Sequencing or Bulk Sequencing library name - A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. library preparation protocol➞library name library preparation - The general method for sequencing library construction (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). library preparation protocol➞library preparation library selection - Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) library preparation protocol➞library selection library type - Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) library preparation protocol➞library type main contact - The person who is the main contact for a committee. data access committee➞main contact - The main contact for the Data Access Committee. modifier - Modifier for Data user permission. data use condition➞modifier - Modifier for Data use permission. Preferable descendants of 'DUO:0000017 data use modifier' name - The name for an entity. data access committee➞name file➞name protocol➞name - Name of the protocol (eg: Sample extraction_PCR amplification). library preparation protocol➞name - Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq library preparation). sequencing protocol➞name - Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sample➞name - Name of the sample (eg:GHGAS_Blood_Sample1 or GHGAS_PBMC_RNAseq_S1). organization - The organization associated with a person. member➞organization - The organization that the Member is part of. permission - Data use permission. data use condition➞permission - Data use permission. Typically one or more terms from DUO. Preferably descendants of 'DUO:0000001 data use permission'. policy text - The complete text for the Data Access Policy. data access policy➞policy text - The terms of data use and policy verbiage should be captured here. policy url - Alternative to pasting the Data Access Policy text. data access policy➞policy url - URL for the policy, if available. This is useful if the terms of the policy is made available online at a resolvable URL. primer - The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. read length - Length of sequencing reads (eg: Long or short or actual number of the read length etc). The number of nucleotides successfully ordered from each side of a nucleic acid fragment obtained after the completion of a sequencing process read pair number - Denotes whether a submitted FASTQ file contains forward (R1) or reverse (R2) reads for paired-end sequencing. The number that identifies each read direction in a paired-end nucleotide sequencing replications. reference annotation - A published genetic sequence that is used as a reference sequence against which other sequences are compared. Reference genome(s) or annotation(s) used for prior analyses (eg: GRCh38.p13). release date - The timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was released for public consumption. replaced by - Refers to the entity which replaces a currently deprecated entity. submission➞replaced by - Refers to the Submission which replaces a currently deprecated Submission. replaces - Refers to a deprecated entity that is being replaced by the current entity. submission➞replaces - Refers to a deprecated Submission that is being replaced by the current Submission. rnaseq strandedness - The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. role - The role that a user has within GHGA. user➞role - The role of the user sample barcode read - The type of read that contains the sample barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). sequencing center - Center where sample was sequenced. sequencing protocol➞sequencing center sequencing length - Long or Short Read. sex - The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. individual➞sex size - The size of a file in bytes. status - The status of an entity. dataset➞status submission➞status - The status of a Submission. For example, 'in progress' or 'submitted'. storage - Methods by which sample is stored (e.g. frozen in liquid nitrogen). submission date - The timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when submission was marked completed. target coverage - Mean coverage for whole genome sequencing, or mean target coverage for whole exome and targeted sequencing. The number of times a particular locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced. target regions - Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. technical replicates - Number of replicate samples (technical replicates). experiment➞technical replicates - A technical replicate is a replicate role where the same BioSample is use e.g. the same pool of RNA used to assess technical (as opposed to biological) variation within an experiment. telephone - The telephone number associated with a person. member➞telephone - The telephone number of the Member. tissue - An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function. sample➞tissue title - The title that describes an entity. dataset➞title experiment process➞title - A descriptive title that explains the step(s) involved in performing the experiment leading up to the sequencing of the sample and generation of raw data from the instrument. (eg: Sample extraction -> Target Enrichment) experiment➞title - Name for the experiment (eg: GHGAE_PBMC_RNAseq). project➞title - Comprehensive title for the project. publication➞title - The title for the Publication. study➞title - Comprehensive title for the study. type - The type of an entity. named thing➞type dataset➞type file➞type - The file type: Aligned Reads, Unaligned Reads, etc. protocol➞type - Type of the protocol (eg: Target enrichment). sample➞type - Type of sample: 'Case' or 'Control'. study➞type - The type of Study. For example, 'Cancer Genomics', 'Epigenetics', 'Exome Sequencing'. umi barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. (E.g. '16'). umi barcode read - The type of read that contains the UMI barcode (Eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). umi barcode size - The size of the UMI identifying barcode (Eg. '10'). update date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. named thing➞update date submission➞update date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the Submission was updated. url - A URL to a resource. protocol➞url - URL for the resource that describes this Protocol. value - The value of an attribute attribute➞value - The value for an attribute. Usually this is a numerical value (without the units). workflow parameter➞value - Value corresponding to the the parameter key. value type - The semantic type for the value of an attribute. attribute➞value type - The value type that characterizes the attribute value. Usually this is a term from an ontology that describes how to interpret the value. For example, 'SIO:001413' indicates that the value is to be interpreted as a percentage. vital status - The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown. individual➞vital status - Last known Vital Status of an Individual. vital status at sampling - Vital Status of an Individual at the point of sampling (eg:'Alive', 'Deceased'). xref - Alternate identifiers for an entity. named thing➞xref - Holds one or more database cross references. protocol➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Protocol. (Eg: manufacturer protocol, protocol from publication etc ) publication➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Publication. sample➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Sample. For example, this Sample may have an EBI BioSamples accession or an EGA Sample accession. year of birth - The year in which the individual was born. Enums ¶ biological_sex_enum - The biological sex of an Individual as determined by their chromosomes. case_control_enum - Enum to capture whether a Sample is to be considered as Case or Control. file_type_enum - Enum to capture file types. status_enum - Enum to capture the status of an entity. study_type_enum - Enum to capture the type of a study. user_role_enum - Enum to capture the different roles a GHGA User can have. vital_status_enum - Enum to capture the vital status of an individual. Subsets ¶ Types ¶ Built in ¶ Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str Defined ¶ Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE
docs.title: Documentation

docs.text: The metadata schema for the German Human Genome-Phenome Archive (GHGA).
docs.title: GHGA-Metadata-Schema schema

docs.text: Attribute - A key/value pair that further characterizes an entity. DataUseCondition - Data Use Condition represents the use conditions associated with a Dataset. A permission field can have one or more terms that collectively defines the data use condition. The modifier determines the interpretation of the use permission(s). NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Agent - An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity. Agents include a Person, Organization, or Software that performs an activity. BiologicalQuality - A biological quality is a quality held by a biological entity. DiseaseOrPhenotypicFeature - Disease or Phenotypic Feature that the entity is associated with. This entity is a union of Disease and Phenotypic Feature and exists to accommodate situations where Disease concepts are used interchangeably with Phenotype concepts or vice-versa. Disease - A disease is a disposition to undergo pathological processes that exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism. PhenotypicFeature - The observable form taken by some character (or group of characters) in an individual or an organism, excluding pathology and disease. The detectable outward manifestations of a specific genotype. Committee - A group of people organized for a specific purpose. DataAccessCommittee - A group of members that are delegated to grant access to one or more datasets after ensuring the minimum criteria for data sharing has been met, and request for data use does not raise ethical and/or legal concerns. InformationContentEntity - A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing. DataAccessPolicy - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. Dataset - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution. AggregateDataset - An Aggregate Dataset is a specialized dataset that is built by combining one or more Datasets together. AnalysisDataset - An Analysis Dataset is a collection of Files generated from one or more Analysis performed on data from one or more Studies. ExperimentDataset - An Experiment Dataset is a collection of Files linked to one or more Experiments from one or more Studies. File Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. LibraryPreparationProtocol - Information about the library preparation of an Experiment. SequencingProtocol - Information about the sequencing of a sample. Publication - The Publication entity represents a publication. While a publication can be any article that is published, the minimum expectation is that the publication has a valid DOI. Technology - A Technology is an abstraction that represents the instrument used for an assay. The Technology entity captures instrument-specific attributes that are relevant for an Experiment entity. The Technology entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular technology. Workflow - A Workflow is an abstraction that represents the workflow used to perform an analysis. The Workflow entity captures workflow-specific attributes that are relevant for an Analysis entity. The Workflow entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular workflow. WorkflowStep - A Workflow Step represents each individual step performed in a Workflow. If the Workflow is a single-step workflow then the Workflow has just one Workflow Step entity. If the Workflow is a multi-step workflow then the Workflow has a Workflow Step entity for each step. All Workflow step specific attributes like parameters, and metadata about execution environment are captured by the Workflow Step entity. MaterialEntity - A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass. AnatomicalEntity - Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species. Biospecimen - A Biospecimen is any natural material taken from a biological entity (usually a human) for testing, diagnostics, treatment, or research purposes. The Biospecimen is linked to the Individual from which the Biospecimen is derived. CellLine - A cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history. Population - A population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area. Cohort - A cohort is a collection of individuals that share a common characteristic/observation and have been grouped together for a research study/investigation. Family - A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption. Sample - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). Person - A member of the species Homo sapiens. Individual - An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. Donor - A Donor is an Individual that participates in a research Study by donating a Biospecimen. The use of the Biospecimen is restricted to the consent provided by the Donor. Member - Member of an Organization or a Committee. User - A user in GHGA. PlannedProcess - A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. AnalysisProcess - An analysis process is a process that describes how one or more Files, from a Study, are transformed to another set of Files via a Workflow. The analysis process also keeps track of the workflow metadata and the Agent that is running the Analysis. DataTransformation - A data transformation technique used to analyze and interpret data to gain a better understanding of it. Analysis - An Analysis is a data transformation that transforms input data to output data. The workflow used to achieve this transformation and the individual steps are also captured. ExperimentProcess - An Experiment Process is a process that describes how a Sample is transformed to a File via an assay. The Experiment Process also keeps track of the Protocol used and the Agent that is running the experiment. Investigation - Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. Experiment - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. Study - Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied. ResearchActivity - A planned process executed in the performance of scientific research wherein systematic investigations are performed to establish facts and reach new conclusions about phenomena in the world. Project - Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. Submission - A grouping entity that represents information about one or more entities. A submission can be considered as a set of inter-related (and inter-connected) entities that represent a data submission to GHGA. WorkflowParameter - A key/value pair that represents a parameter used in a Workflow Step.
docs.title: Classes

docs.text: abstract - The study abstract that describes the goals. Can also hold abstract from a publication related to this study accession - A unique identifier assigned to an entity for the sole purpose of referring to that entity in a global scope. named thing➞accession additional name - Additional name(s). affiliation - Institutions associated with this study. study➞affiliation age - Age of an individual. individual➞age ancestry - A person's descent or lineage, from a person or from a population. biological replicates - Number of independent samples (biological replicates). experiment➞biological replicates - A biological replicate is a replicate role that consists of independent biological replicates made from different individual biosamples. category - The category for this file: Whole Genome Sequencing, Whole Exome Sequencing, etc. cell barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. (Eg. '0'). cell barcode read - The type of read that contains the cell barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). cell barcode size - The size of the cell identifying barcode (E.g. '16'). checksum - A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. creation date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. named thing➞creation date submission➞creation date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the Submission was created. deprecation date - The timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was deprecated. description - Description of an entity. data access policy➞description - A short description for the Data Access Policy. dataset➞description experiment➞description - A detailed description of the Experiment. project➞description - Short textual description of the project (Some information on the protocol, sample used and collected etc) protocol➞description - Detailed description of the Protocol. library preparation protocol➞description - Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). sequencing protocol➞description - Description about the sequencing protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sample➞description - Short textual description of the sample (How the sample was collected, sample source, protocol followed for processing the sample etc). study➞description - A detailed description (abstract) that describes the goals of this Study. email - Email of a person. member➞email - The email of the Member. end bias - The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. ethnicity - A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. experimental replicates - Number of experiment replications. experiment➞experimental replicates - The replicate number of the assay, i.e. the numeric iteration for the assay that was repeated. family name - Last name. file index - The index for this file. Commonly for BAM/VCF files. flow cell id - Flow Cell ID (eg: Experiment ID_Cell 1_Lane_1). The barcode assigned to a flow cell used in nucleotide sequencing. flow cell type - Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell. format - The format of the file: BAM, SAM, CRAM, BAI, etc. gender - Identification as male/masculine, female/feminine or something else, and association with a (social) role or set of behavioral and cultural traits. geographical region - The geographical region where the Individual is located. Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries. given name - First name. has agent - A person or an entity that is performing a Planned Process entity. analysis process➞has agent - The Agent - a software, institution, or human - that is executing or responsible for executing the workflow. experiment process➞has agent - The Agent - a software, institution, or human - that is executing or responsible for executing the Experiment Process. has analysis - The analysis associated with an entity. study➞has analysis - One or more Analysis entities associated with this Study. submission➞has analysis - Information about one or more Analysis entities associated with this submission. has analysis process analysis➞has analysis process - One or more Analysis Process entities associated with this Analysis. has anatomical entity - Anatomical site associated with an entity. biospecimen➞has anatomical entity - The Anatomical entity, that represents the site, from which the Biospecimen was retrieved. Typically, a concept from Uber-anatomy Ontology (UBERON). For example, 'UBERON:0008307' indicates that the Biospecimen was extracted from the 'Heart Endothelium' of an Individual. has attribute - Key/value pairs corresponding to an entity. named thing➞has attribute - Holds one or more Attribute entities that further characterizes this entity. project➞has attribute - Custom attributes for the Project (eg: Cancer - Colon cancer, prostrate cancer, blood cancer etc) protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Protocol. library preparation protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. sequencing protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Sequencing Protocol. study➞has attribute - Custom key/value pairs that further characterizes the Study. (e.g.: approaches - single-cell, bulk etc) has biospecimen - The biospecimen associated with an entity. sample➞has biospecimen - The Biospecimen from which this Sample was prepared from. submission➞has biospecimen - Information about one or more Biospecimen entities associated with this submission. has children - The children of an entity. individual➞has children - One or more children for this Individual. has data access committee - Data Access Committee associated with an entity. data access policy➞has data access committee - The Data Access Committee linked to this policy. has data access policy - Data Access Policy associated with an entity. analysis dataset➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to this Dataset. experiment dataset➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to this Dataset. submission➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy entity that applies to the data associated with this submission. has data use condition - Data Use Condition entities that are associated with an entity. data access policy➞has data use condition - Data Use Condition entities that are associated with the Data Access Policy. has dataset - The Dataset associated with an entity. aggregate dataset➞has dataset - One or more Datasets that constitutes this Aggregate Dataset. has disease - Disease concept that the entity is associated with. biospecimen➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0005267' indicates that the Individual suffers from 'Heart Disease'. individual➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. has experiment - The experiment associated with an entity. analysis dataset➞has experiment - One or more Analysis entities that are referenced by this Dataset. experiment dataset➞has experiment - One or more Experiment entities that are referenced by this Dataset. study➞has experiment - One or more Experiment entities associated with this Study. submission➞has experiment - Information about one or more Experiment entities associated with this submission. has experiment process experiment➞has experiment process - One or more Experiment Processes entities associated with this Experiment. has file - The file associated with an entity. dataset➞has file - One or more File entities that collectively are part of this Dataset. experiment➞has file - One or more Files entities that are generated as output of this Experiment. submission➞has file - Information about one or more File entities associated with this submission. has individual - The subject/individual associated with an entity. biospecimen➞has individual - The Individual entity from which this Biospecimen was derived. sample➞has individual - The Individual from which this Sample was derived from. submission➞has individual - Information about one or more Individual entities associated with this submission. has input - The input to a Planned Process. analysis process➞has input - The input data File entities used in the Analysis Process. analysis➞has input - The input data File entities used in the Analysis. experiment process➞has input - The input to the Experiment Process. Usually a Sample entity. has library preparation protocol - The Library Preparation Protocol associated with an entity. has member - The members associated with a committee. cohort➞has member - One or more Individuals that collectively define this Cohort. data access committee➞has member - All the members that are part of this Data Access Committee. family➞has member - One or more Individuals that collectively define this Family. has output - The output of a Planned Process entity. analysis process➞has output - The output data File entities generated by the Analysis Process. analysis➞has output - The output data File entities generated by this Analysis. experiment process➞has output - The output of this Experiment Process. Usually a File entity. has parameter - The parameter(s) associated with a Workflow Step entity. workflow step➞has parameter - One or more parameters that are associated with this Workflow Step. has parent - The parent of an entity. individual➞has parent - One or more parent for this Individual. has phenotypic feature - Phenotypic feature concept that the entity is associated with. biospecimen➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. individual➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. has proband - The Individual that is reported to have a disorder in a Family. family➞has proband - The Individual that is reported to have a disorder which results in the Family being brought into a Study. has project - The project associated with an entity. study➞has project - The project associated with this Study. submission➞has project - Information about a Project entity associated with this submission. has protocol - The protocol associated with an entity. experiment process➞has protocol - The Protocol entity used by this Experiment Process. has publication - The Publication associated with an entity. dataset➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Dataset. project➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Project. study➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Study. has sample - The sample associated with an entity. experiment➞has sample - The Sample entity associated with this Experiment. submission➞has sample - Information about one or more Sample entities associated with this submission. has sequencing protocol - The sequencing protocol associated with an entity. has study - The study associated with an entity. analysis dataset➞has study - One or more Study entities that are referenced by this Dataset. analysis➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Analysis. experiment dataset➞has study - One or more Study entities that are referenced by this Dataset. experiment➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Experiment. project➞has study - One or more Study entities associated with this Project. submission➞has study - Information about a Study entities associated with this submission. has technology - The technology associated with an entity. experiment➞has technology - The Technology entity associated with this Experiment. has workflow - The Workflow entity associated wtih a Planned Process entity. analysis➞has workflow - The Workflow entity associated with this Analysis. has workflow step - The individual workflow step that with other workflow step(s) collectively defines a Workflow entity. analysis process➞has workflow step - Workflow Step entity that performs a set of operations on the input data Files to generate a set of output data Files. id - An identifier that uniquely represents an entity. named thing➞id - The internal unique identifier for an entity. publication➞id - A PMID or DOI for the Publication. submission➞id - A internal unique identifier for the Submission. instrument model - The name and model of the technology platform used to perform sequencing. sequencing protocol➞instrument model isolation - Method or device employed for collecting/isolating a sample. key - The key of an attribute. attribute➞key - The key for an attribute. workflow parameter➞key - Key that represents the parameter name. key type - The semantic type for the key of an attribute. attribute➞key type - A semantic type that characterizes the attribute key. Usually this is a term from an ontology. For example, 'MAXO:0000616' indicates that the attribute is a measurement of oxygen saturation in the blood. lane number - he numerical identifier for the lane or machine unit where a sample was located during nucleotide sequencing. library construction - The name of a library construction approach being used. (eg: '10X v2 sequencing' or 'Smart-seq2') library preparation protocol➞library construction library construction kit manufacturer - Manufacturer of library construction kit library preparation protocol➞library construction kit manufacturer library construction kit retail name - A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) library preparation protocol➞library construction kit retail name library layout - Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode library preparation protocol➞library layout library level - Single Cell Sequencing or Bulk Sequencing library name - A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. library preparation protocol➞library name library preparation - The general method for sequencing library construction (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). library preparation protocol➞library preparation library selection - Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) library preparation protocol➞library selection library type - Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) library preparation protocol➞library type main contact - The person who is the main contact for a committee. data access committee➞main contact - The main contact for the Data Access Committee. modifier - Modifier for Data user permission. data use condition➞modifier - Modifier for Data use permission. Preferable descendants of 'DUO:0000017 data use modifier' name - The name for an entity. data access committee➞name file➞name protocol➞name - Name of the protocol (eg: Sample extraction_PCR amplification). library preparation protocol➞name - Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq library preparation). sequencing protocol➞name - Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sample➞name - Name of the sample (eg:GHGAS_Blood_Sample1 or GHGAS_PBMC_RNAseq_S1). organization - The organization associated with a person. member➞organization - The organization that the Member is part of. permission - Data use permission. data use condition➞permission - Data use permission. Typically one or more terms from DUO. Preferably descendants of 'DUO:0000001 data use permission'. policy text - The complete text for the Data Access Policy. data access policy➞policy text - The terms of data use and policy verbiage should be captured here. policy url - Alternative to pasting the Data Access Policy text. data access policy➞policy url - URL for the policy, if available. This is useful if the terms of the policy is made available online at a resolvable URL. primer - The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. read length - Length of sequencing reads (eg: Long or short or actual number of the read length etc). The number of nucleotides successfully ordered from each side of a nucleic acid fragment obtained after the completion of a sequencing process read pair number - Denotes whether a submitted FASTQ file contains forward (R1) or reverse (R2) reads for paired-end sequencing. The number that identifies each read direction in a paired-end nucleotide sequencing replications. reference annotation - A published genetic sequence that is used as a reference sequence against which other sequences are compared. Reference genome(s) or annotation(s) used for prior analyses (eg: GRCh38.p13). release date - The timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was released for public consumption. replaced by - Refers to the entity which replaces a currently deprecated entity. submission➞replaced by - Refers to the Submission which replaces a currently deprecated Submission. replaces - Refers to a deprecated entity that is being replaced by the current entity. submission➞replaces - Refers to a deprecated Submission that is being replaced by the current Submission. rnaseq strandedness - The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. role - The role that a user has within GHGA. user➞role - The role of the user sample barcode read - The type of read that contains the sample barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). sequencing center - Center where sample was sequenced. sequencing protocol➞sequencing center sequencing length - Long or Short Read. sex - The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. individual➞sex size - The size of a file in bytes. status - The status of an entity. dataset➞status submission➞status - The status of a Submission. For example, 'in progress' or 'submitted'. storage - Methods by which sample is stored (e.g. frozen in liquid nitrogen). submission date - The timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when submission was marked completed. target coverage - Mean coverage for whole genome sequencing, or mean target coverage for whole exome and targeted sequencing. The number of times a particular locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced. target regions - Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. technical replicates - Number of replicate samples (technical replicates). experiment➞technical replicates - A technical replicate is a replicate role where the same BioSample is use e.g. the same pool of RNA used to assess technical (as opposed to biological) variation within an experiment. telephone - The telephone number associated with a person. member➞telephone - The telephone number of the Member. tissue - An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function. sample➞tissue title - The title that describes an entity. dataset➞title experiment process➞title - A descriptive title that explains the step(s) involved in performing the experiment leading up to the sequencing of the sample and generation of raw data from the instrument. (eg: Sample extraction -> Target Enrichment) experiment➞title - Name for the experiment (eg: GHGAE_PBMC_RNAseq). project➞title - Comprehensive title for the project. publication➞title - The title for the Publication. study➞title - Comprehensive title for the study. type - The type of an entity. named thing➞type dataset➞type file➞type - The file type: Aligned Reads, Unaligned Reads, etc. protocol➞type - Type of the protocol (eg: Target enrichment). sample➞type - Type of sample: 'Case' or 'Control'. study➞type - The type of Study. For example, 'Cancer Genomics', 'Epigenetics', 'Exome Sequencing'. umi barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. (E.g. '16'). umi barcode read - The type of read that contains the UMI barcode (Eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). umi barcode size - The size of the UMI identifying barcode (Eg. '10'). update date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. named thing➞update date submission➞update date - Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the Submission was updated. url - A URL to a resource. protocol➞url - URL for the resource that describes this Protocol. value - The value of an attribute attribute➞value - The value for an attribute. Usually this is a numerical value (without the units). workflow parameter➞value - Value corresponding to the the parameter key. value type - The semantic type for the value of an attribute. attribute➞value type - The value type that characterizes the attribute value. Usually this is a term from an ontology that describes how to interpret the value. For example, 'SIO:001413' indicates that the value is to be interpreted as a percentage. vital status - The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown. individual➞vital status - Last known Vital Status of an Individual. vital status at sampling - Vital Status of an Individual at the point of sampling (eg:'Alive', 'Deceased'). xref - Alternate identifiers for an entity. named thing➞xref - Holds one or more database cross references. protocol➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Protocol. (Eg: manufacturer protocol, protocol from publication etc ) publication➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Publication. sample➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Sample. For example, this Sample may have an EBI BioSamples accession or an EGA Sample accession. year of birth - The year in which the individual was born.
docs.title: Slots

docs.text: biological_sex_enum - The biological sex of an Individual as determined by their chromosomes. case_control_enum - Enum to capture whether a Sample is to be considered as Case or Control. file_type_enum - Enum to capture file types. status_enum - Enum to capture the status of an entity. study_type_enum - Enum to capture the type of a study. user_role_enum - Enum to capture the different roles a GHGA User can have. vital_status_enum - Enum to capture the vital status of an individual.

docs.text: Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE
docs.title: Defined

docs.text: Class: agent ¶ An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity. docs.text: Class: biospecimen ¶ A Biospecimen is any natural material taken from a biological entity (usually a human) for testing, diagnostics, treatment, or research purposes. The Biospecimen is linked to the Individual from which the Biospecimen is derived. URI: GHGA:Biospecimen Parents ¶ is_a: MaterialEntity - A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass. Referenced by Class ¶ None has biospecimen 0..1 Biospecimen Sample sample➞has biospecimen 0..1 Biospecimen Submission submission➞has biospecimen 0..* Biospecimen Attributes ¶ Own ¶ name 0..1 Description: The name for an entity. Range: String description 0..1 Description: Description of an entity. Range: String biospecimen➞has individual 0..1 Description: The Individual entity from which this Biospecimen was derived. Range: Individual biospecimen➞has anatomical entity 0..1 Description: The Anatomical entity, that represents the site, from which the Biospecimen was retrieved. Typically, a concept from Uber-anatomy Ontology (UBERON). For example, 'UBERON:0008307' indicates that the Biospecimen was extracted from the 'Heart Endothelium' of an Individual. docs.text: Class: donor ¶ A Donor is an Individual that participates in a research Study by donating a Biospecimen. The use of the Biospecimen is restricted to the consent provided by the Donor. URI: GHGA:Donor Parents ¶ is_a: Individual - An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. Attributes ¶ Inherited from individual: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String named thing➞accession 0..1 Description: A unique identifier assigned to an entity for the sole purpose of referring to that entity in a global scope. Range: String named thing➞xref 0..* Description: Holds one or more database cross references. Range: String named thing➞type 0..1 Description: The type of an entity. Range: String named thing➞has attribute 0..* Description: Holds one or more Attribute entities that further characterizes this entity. Range: Attribute named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String replaces 0..1 Description: Refers to a deprecated entity that is being replaced by the current entity. Range: NamedThing replaced by 0..1 Description: Refers to the entity which replaces a currently deprecated entity. Range: NamedThing given name 0..1 Description: First name. Range: String family name 0..1 Description: Last name. Range: String additional name 0..1 Description: Additional name(s). Range: String gender 0..1 Description: Identification as male/masculine, female/feminine or something else, and association with a (social) role or set of behavioral and cultural traits. Range: String individual➞sex 1..1 Description: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. Range: biological_sex_enum individual➞age 1..1 Description: Age of an individual. Range: Integer year of birth 0..1 Description: The year in which the individual was born. Range: String individual➞vital status 1..1 Description: Last known Vital Status of an Individual. Range: vital_status_enum geographical region 0..1 Description: The geographical region where the Individual is located. Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries. Range: String ethnicity 0..1 Description: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Range: String ancestry 0..1 Description: A person's descent or lineage, from a person or from a population. Range: String individual➞has parent 0..* Description: One or more parent for this Individual. Range: Individual individual➞has children 0..* Description: One or more children for this Individual. Range: Individual individual➞has disease 0..* Description: The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. Range: Disease individual➞has phenotypic feature 0..* Description: The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. Range: PhenotypicFeature Other properties ¶ Aliases: participant

docs.text: Class: information content entity ¶ A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing. URI: GHGA:InformationContentEntity Parents ¶ is_a: NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Children ¶ DataAccessPolicy - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. Dataset - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution. File Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Publication - The Publication entity represents a publication. While a publication can be any article that is published, the minimum expectation is that the publication has a valid DOI. Technology - A Technology is an abstraction that represents the instrument used for an assay. The Technology entity captures instrument-specific attributes that are relevant for an Experiment entity. The Technology entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular technology. Workflow - A Workflow is an abstraction that represents the workflow used to perform an analysis. The Workflow entity captures workflow-specific attributes that are relevant for an Analysis entity. The Workflow entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular workflow. WorkflowStep - A Workflow Step represents each individual step performed in a Workflow. If the Workflow is a single-step workflow then the Workflow has just one Workflow Step entity. If the Workflow is a multi-step workflow then the Workflow has a Workflow Step entity for each step. All Workflow step specific attributes like parameters, and metadata about execution environment are captured by the Workflow Step entity. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Inherited from named thing: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String named thing➞accession 0..1 Description: A unique identifier assigned to an entity for the sole purpose of referring to that entity in a global scope. Range: String named thing➞xref 0..* Description: Holds one or more database cross references. Range: String named thing➞type 0..1 Description: The type of an entity. Range: String named thing➞has attribute 0..* Description: Holds one or more Attribute entities that further characterizes this entity. Range: Attribute named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String replaces 0..1 Description: Refers to a deprecated entity that is being replaced by the current entity. Range: NamedThing replaced by 0..1 Description: Refers to the entity which replaces a currently deprecated entity. Range: NamedThing Other properties ¶ Exact Mappings: IAO:0000030

docs.text: Class: investigation ¶ Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. URI: GHGA:Investigation Parents ¶ is_a: PlannedProcess - A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. Children ¶ Experiment - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. docs.text: Class: library preparation protocol ¶ Information about the library preparation of an Experiment. URI: GHGA:LibraryPreparationProtocol Parents ¶ is_a: Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Own ¶ library preparation protocol➞library name 1..1 Description: A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. Range: String library preparation protocol➞library layout 1..1 Description: Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode Range: String library preparation protocol➞library type 1..1 Description: Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) Range: String library preparation protocol➞library selection 1..1 Description: Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) Range: String library preparation protocol➞library construction 1..1 Description: The name of a library construction approach being used. (eg: '10X v2 sequencing' or 'Smart-seq2') Range: String library preparation protocol➞library preparation 1..1 Description: The general method for sequencing library construction (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). Range: String library level 0..1 Description: Single Cell Sequencing or Bulk Sequencing Range: String library preparation protocol➞library construction kit retail name 1..1 Description: A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) Range: String library preparation protocol➞library construction kit manufacturer 1..1 Description: Manufacturer of library construction kit Range: String primer 0..1 Description: The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. Range: String end bias 0..1 Description: The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. Range: String target regions 0..1 Description: Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. Range: String rnaseq strandedness 0..1 Description: The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. Range: String library preparation protocol➞name 1..1 Description: Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq library preparation). Range: String library preparation protocol➞description 1..1 Description: Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). Range: String library preparation protocol➞has attribute 0..* Description: One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. Range: Attribute Inherited from protocol: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity.
