docs.title: Class: library preparation protocol

docs.text: is_a: Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.
docs.title: Parents

docs.text: library preparation protocol➞library name 1..1 Description: A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. Range: String library preparation protocol➞library layout 1..1 Description: Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode Range: String library preparation protocol➞library type 1..1 Description: Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) Range: String library preparation protocol➞library selection 1..1 Description: Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) Range: String library preparation protocol➞library construction 1..1 Description: The name of a library construction approach being used. (eg: '10X v2 sequencing' or 'Smart-seq2') Range: String library preparation protocol➞library preparation 1..1 Description: The general method for sequencing library construction (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). Range: String library level 0..1 Description: Single Cell Sequencing or Bulk Sequencing Range: String library preparation protocol➞library construction kit retail name 1..1 Description: A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) Range: String library preparation protocol➞library construction kit manufacturer 1..1 Description: Manufacturer of library construction kit Range: String primer 0..1 Description: The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. Range: String end bias 0..1 Description: The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. Range: String target regions 0..1 Description: Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. Range: String rnaseq strandedness 0..1 Description: The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. Range: String library preparation protocol➞name 1..1 Description: Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq library preparation). Range: String library preparation protocol➞description 1..1 Description: Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). Range: String library preparation protocol➞has attribute 0..* Description: One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. Range: Attribute

docs.text: Class: material entity ¶ A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass. URI: GHGA:MaterialEntity Parents ¶ is_a: NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Children ¶ AnatomicalEntity - Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species. Biospecimen - A Biospecimen is any natural material taken from a biological entity (usually a human) for testing, diagnostics, treatment, or research purposes. The Biospecimen is linked to the Individual from which the Biospecimen is derived. CellLine - A cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history. Population - A population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area. Sample - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). docs.text: Class: planned process ¶ A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. URI: GHGA:PlannedProcess Parents ¶ is_a: NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Children ¶ AnalysisProcess - An analysis process is a process that describes how one or more Files, from a Study, are transformed to another set of Files via a Workflow. The analysis process also keeps track of the workflow metadata and the Agent that is running the Analysis. DataTransformation - A data transformation technique used to analyze and interpret data to gain a better understanding of it. ExperimentProcess - An Experiment Process is a process that describes how a Sample is transformed to a File via an assay. The Experiment Process also keeps track of the Protocol used and the Agent that is running the experiment. Investigation - Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. ResearchActivity - A planned process executed in the performance of scientific research wherein systematic investigations are performed to establish facts and reach new conclusions about phenomena in the world. docs.text: Class: sequencing protocol ¶ Information about the sequencing of a sample. URI: GHGA:SequencingProtocol Parents ¶ is_a: Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Own ¶ sequencing protocol➞sequencing center 1..1 Description: Center where sample was sequenced. Range: String sequencing protocol➞instrument model 1..1 Description: The name and model of the technology platform used to perform sequencing. Range: String read length 0..1 Description: Length of sequencing reads (eg: Long or short or actual number of the read length etc). The number of nucleotides successfully ordered from each side of a nucleic acid fragment obtained after the completion of a sequencing process Range: String read pair number 0..1 Description: Denotes whether a submitted FASTQ file contains forward (R1) or reverse (R2) reads for paired-end sequencing. The number that identifies each read direction in a paired-end nucleotide sequencing replications. Range: String sequencing length 0..1 Description: Long or Short Read. Range: String target coverage 0..1 Description: Mean coverage for whole genome sequencing, or mean target coverage for whole exome and targeted sequencing. The number of times a particular locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced. Range: String reference annotation 0..1 Description: A published genetic sequence that is used as a reference sequence against which other sequences are compared. Reference genome(s) or annotation(s) used for prior analyses (eg: GRCh38.p13). Range: String lane number 0..1 Description: he numerical identifier for the lane or machine unit where a sample was located during nucleotide sequencing. Range: String flow cell id 0..1 Description: Flow Cell ID (eg: Experiment ID_Cell 1_Lane_1). The barcode assigned to a flow cell used in nucleotide sequencing. Range: String flow cell type 0..1 Description: Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell. Range: String umi barcode read 0..1 Description: The type of read that contains the UMI barcode (Eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). Range: String umi barcode size 0..1 Description: The size of the UMI identifying barcode (Eg. '10'). Range: String umi barcode offset 0..1 Description: The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. (E.g. '16'). Range: String cell barcode read 0..1 Description: The type of read that contains the cell barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). Range: String cell barcode offset 0..1 Description: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. (Eg. '0'). Range: String cell barcode size 0..1 Description: The size of the cell identifying barcode (E.g. '16'). Range: String sample barcode read 0..1 Description: The type of read that contains the sample barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). Range: String sequencing protocol➞name 0..1 Description: Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). Range: String sequencing protocol➞description 0..1 Description: Description about the sequencing protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). Range: String sequencing protocol➞has attribute 0..* Description: One or more attributes that further characterizes this Sequencing Protocol. Range: Attribute Inherited from protocol: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: NamedThing replaced by 0..1 Description: Refers to the entity which replaces a currently deprecated entity. docs.text: Class: workflow step ¶ A Workflow Step represents each individual step performed in a Workflow. docs.text: Slot: checksum ¶ A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. URI: GHGA:checksum Domain and Range ¶ None → 0..1 String Parents ¶ Children ¶ Used by ¶ File Other properties ¶ Exact Mappings: NCIT:C43522
docs.title: Slot: checksum

docs.text: A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. docs.text: Slot: flow cell type ¶ Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet.
